headline: Simple Turkey Chili
description: This turkey chili recipe is made with ground turkey, tomatoes, kidney beans, and spices that make it super flavorful. Even better on the second day!

video.description: See how to make a simple but hearty turkey chili with beans.
video.name: Simple Turkey Chili

name: Simple Turkey Chili
recipeIngredient: 1 (16 ounce) can canned kidney beans - drained, rinsed, and mashed

recipeInstructions.text: Heat oil in a large pot over medium heat. Add turkey; cook and stir until evenly browned, 6 to 8 minutes. Stir in onion and cook until tender.
Add water; mix in tomatoes, kidney beans, and garlic. Stir in chili powder, paprika, oregano, cayenne pepper, cumin, salt, and pepper.
Bring to a boil. Reduce heat to low, cover, and simmer for 30 minutes.

review.reviewBody: My family and friends loved this. Instead of water I used low sodium chicken broth and I added an extra onion. I forgot to mash the beans but it still came out delicious.
I loved this turkey chili! It's easy and delicious and healthy. I didn't mash the beans, and I added an additional can of beans, and it was awesome.
Amazing and easy to put together

I just made this for the first time. I added chopped red bell pepper, a can of black beans along with the kidney beans (not smashed) and chicken broth instead of water. Delicious. Just spicy enough. A tweak away from “ perfect”
My go to in the winter. Easy to double the recipe for next day lunch! Yummy!
No flavor. Very soupy. I could not choke it down.
Quick and easy. I followed the recipe exactly as it's written. Made enough for my family of 6. My partner, who is picky, loved it as well as the kids.
Basic recipe can't go wrong. Used black beans and rinsed. Onions first then garlic then add turkey!

I’m making this right now. I used chicken broth instead of water and used black beans. Something is missing from this recipe, I keep adding more like onion powder, garlic powder…but it still falls flat. Not sure what to do to bring it to life.

Very easy to make. Enjoyed the taste, but so use to beef being in my Chili, so tasted a little odd at first, but I am using ground Turkey much more now for all my cooking. Strongly suggest this for anyone looking for an easy to make satisfying chili.
I have been making this recipe for a few years now. The whole family loves it and it is easy to make!
Had no cumin, how do use caraway seeds that I somehow had… Luckily, also had a mortar and pestle.
I've been making this recipe for a few years now..it's fantastic..I don't like cumin so I skip that and add lots of veggies..diced tomato, bell peppers, white onions. Absolutely delicious

I was worried as it didn’t call for tomato paste. Yet, none needed! Follow this recipe exactly as it says and you’re golden! I added extra spices such as harissa (buy some, it’s not very spicy) and others. Turned out great!
Delicious

hey this wasn't bad; had some leftover turkey from roasing a breast of turkey and some leftover pinto beans. so used this recipe to use them up; went by the recipe pretty much. used a can of Rotel and a can of organic fire roasted diced tomatoes for the tomatoes. came out really good for a quick and easy recipe using leftovers.
Added a can of fire roasted hatch chili and an added can of kidney beans. Sub water with chicken bullion. Was delish with cornbread and a little sour cream and cheese.

Easy and delicious. I made it spicier - you usually have to season to taste - but I'm glad recipes underseason because I don't like really spicy food. I didn't have kidney beans so I used black beans. Of course, if doesn't make any difference.

I made this today except for the following changes: 1 can of water instead of 2. 2 cans of chilli beans instead of kidney beans. No cayenne pepper (guest can add additional spice to their taste). I used 1 can of stewed tomatoes. It was more watery than i like so I added a 1/3 cup of masa flour to thicken it. The flavor is delicious.

I used ingredients as stated except ,
1) I sauteed the onions and garlic, then cooked the meat, and then combined them. 
2) I found I did not have to add water. There was enough juice from the tomatoes (boxed not canned) and the turkey added some.
3) I don't know how you can add two tablespoons of chili powder and still have an edible dish. I used a half teaspoon together with the other spices as specified and it still comes out on the hot side. Either I have extra hot chili or I have a very low tolerance for heat.

I used 1/2 tsp cayenne and it was too much. So I cooked 8oz of macaroni and added that. Then I let it simmer 75 minutes. After it sat on the fridge 2 days, I warmed it snd served it with grated cheddar. It was really delicious.

Delicious! I've been making chili for years, but decided to change it up and use a different recipe. So glad I did! I doubled this to make enough for the neighbors and I ran out of chili powder, so I had to use 2 tbsp of chipotle chili powder and 2tbsp of regular. It was spicy and awesome!! Thank you for opening my eyes to something new, and no one knew it was ground turkey and not ground chuck!! My neighbors and my son raved about this chili!!
Very excellent recipe.

This has been one of my go-to recipes for years. Sometimes we use turkey, sometimes bison or lean hamburger. I add a bit of sugar to the acidic tomatoes, as well as a little cocoa powder. I always add cubed, roasted sweet potatoes. Great stuff!
I doubled the recipe. I used fresh garlic, whole cut up. Added green pepper and smoked pepper.
Love it and so does the whole family!
Was looking for a turkey chili that looked like traditional chili and this was perfect! No need to change anything. Thanks for sharing!
Fantastic, made it with ground turkey.
Great turkey chili recipe. Easy to make, quick and tasty. I’ve always thought chili should be made with beef but I prefer this turkey recipe!
Added a can of Cannellini beans, half a green pepper and a Jalapeno. Skipped the water. Nice hearty chili served with home baked bread and a spinach salad
Like others have said, use less water, add some cinnamon, double the cumin, and sauté the onions and garlic separately. I threw some fresh cilantro in as well. So good.
This is the best chili we have ever had. My husband goes on and on about how good it is. Very quick and easy to make. I made no changes. Its amazing. thanks so much.
I added some season salt and a little chili low sodium mix to it.

The serving suggestion of low-fat dairy products should have been a red flag. This recipe has great ingredients, but no flavor. Definitely do NOT use water for the liquid. I subbed chicken broth, doubled the spices, and added a can of sweet corn, which revived it a bit. Would not use again as a base recipe.

I, my husband and my 7 year old daughter all love it. I made it twice now and the second time I used a meatloaf ground meat and also added ham (cubed it and threw it in with the beans). It was soooo good. Definitely has a spicy kick so someone who doesn't tolerate spice may need to adjust the cayenne pepper. So so good and so easy to make!
I used chicken broth rather that water. Very flavorful and easy to make
Waaay too hot. I cut the cayenne down and even my husband, who enjoys the heat, agreed. I couldn’t eat it.

I’ve made this turkey chili several times and we love it! I add a can of black beans to go along with the kidney beans. I also cut up a couple of bell peppers to throw in. These additions make it a bit heartier.

Flavor was great (I went a drop lighter on the cayenne pepper though so my kids could eat it too) but I thought it was way too watery. Next time I’ll reduce the water but would make it again with that change.

Its a family favorite. I have adapted the recipe over the years. I add 3 cans of beans (Pinto, Kidney, & Chili Beans) I don't mash them. It really needs these extra beans to make it more hearty. I also use Chicken broth instead of water. And reduce the cayene so not too spicy. And 2 TBSP of brown sugar. Sometimes I make with Beyond Meat so my vegan husband can eat it and its just as good. Yum!

This is THE best chili i ever ate! It's also the easiest i ever made. Been eating ground turkey in place of ground beef all my life. (My mom was way ahead when it came to cooking style.) The spices in this were a surprise to me for a chili recipe but i don't follow many recipes either. It was wonderful. That's the best i can say & if you don't try it, you're missing out on a GREAT chili!
Used 1 tsp crushed red pepper instead of chili powder. Smoked paprika instead of paprika
Good recipe.

Been trying different recipes and this one was a keeper. I like that it's ready pretty quick compared to some chili recipes and that it has very basic ingredients that I always have available. I also like that is has more liquid than other recipes I'v e tried. Doubled the recipe and used a can of medium spiced chili beans instead of kidney. Also added some chopped bell pepper. This one was a hit with the family
Been using this recipe for years now, I love it! I only make some slight modifications to my preferences (no onion, tomato sauce instead of diced)
Good recipe, I did add carrots, 2 cans of kidney beans, 1 1/2# of turkey, chicken broth instead of water. Will make again. Might try beef broth next time.

Reduce the water to 1 cup from 2 cups else its too watery. For kids, I left out the cayenne pepper and reduced the chili powder to 1 tablespoon. I accidentally used a sweet onion, but it came out very good. I should have made more.
Very yummy as is! I added some celery and carrots just for my personal preference and I also went with chick broth instead of plain water, but great recipe!
This was so great! Love the simplicity and the flavor. Thanks!

This was great with some tweaks. Per the notes, I added a chopped bell pepper and sautéed it with the onion until soft, then added the turkey, and used chicken broth instead of water. I’d probably use less broth since it was a tad soupy. Probably go with 1 1/2 cups instead of 2 cups. Finally, I cooked it all in a pot as directed but after the simmering, I transferred it to a Crock Pot on low for 6 hours. Came out awesome!

I made a huge batch of this!!! Serving 24pp!! It was delicious!! I cut the amount of water in half because I like my chili to be thick and hearty! I also substituted 1 can of diced tomato. I added two small cans of Hatch Diced Green Chiles juice included for added flavor!

I've literlly prepared this recipe 100 times. My friends request "the famous turkey chili" whenever I offer to make them a meal!

I put a southwest twist on mine:
1. Add a can of black beans
2. Add frozen corn (adds nice color!)
3. Add a bit of fresh diced tomatoes
4. Add one extra cup of water

Top with:
- Homemade tortilla strips
- Sour cream
- Cilantro
- Shredded cheddar cheese

This was so simple to put together & super yummy! I did make a couple edits, I used vegetable broth instead of water & I added an extra can of kidney beans. Flavor is good with all the seasonings, a bit of heat without being overpowering.
Used hamburger and chipotle powder
Cool easy recipe I changed amount of seasoning to my my liking
I was surprised how simple it was. I did do a few personal touches, including adding some sweet corn. This is definite hit.

It a very gold standard chili recipe. I’ve made it numerous times. JWorks out fine each time. No changed necessary. All easy ingredients to acquire or have on hand. Its an easy recipe for beginners. It’s a recipe that you can adjust to your own personal tastes If you desire. People always ask for more!

It a very gold standard chili recipe. I’ve made it numerous times. JWorks out fine each time. No changed necessary. All easy ingredients to acquire or have on hand. Its an easy recipe for beginners. It’s a recipe that you can adjust to your own personal tastes If you desire. People always ask for more!

This was an excellent recipe.I added 1 jalapeño and had an assortment of toppings which included guacamole, avocado, sour cream Greek yogurt Trader Joe black olives and shredded Mexican cheese. Everyone loved it. I doubled the recipe too!

I didn’t have crushed tomatoes instead I used 1 can 15 oz tomatoes sauce, 1 can 14 oz petite diced tomatoes and one can of tomatoes paste. Instead of two cups water I used 1 cup chicken both and 1 cup of water. I added 1 tb sugar and a dash of cinnamon. Also an extra can of beans. Delicious! Ate it with a slice of corn bread and side salad!
4.5 Stars....It's easy and very good.
AWESOME flavor! I substituted garlic powder for minced garlic and added a pinch of sugar and a half teaspoon of pepper flakes. I'm serving over a bed of rice

My family loves this recipe. Even my picky little kids devour this chili. I've made it with turkey and ground beef. Both are excellent. I do modify it a little. I add one can of dark red kidney beans one can of light red kidney beans and one can of chili beans. I also add bell peppers.

Follow this recipe to the “T” for the amount of spices and you will not be disappointed. I’ve made it with ground turkey and ground chicken and they are both delicious. The only change I made it I also add tomato paste for a richer color and flavor. Tastes like it simmered for hours.

Me and my Fiancee really enjoyed this dish. I have no problem making it again. The only thing that I would change is to maybe cut back a bit on the spices in it; it worked well for my Fiancee and I, especially with the addition of sour cream and cheddar cheese--but it did not sit too well with her seven year old, so I felt a bit bad. 
I would give this 5 stars for flavor and ease of cooking; but I am going with 4 because of how MUCH of a kick it had. Other people may need a heads up for this kind of thing.

Recipe with a good spice balance. I agree with other reviewers in that this recipe is a little thin as written. I ended up simmering for > 2 hours; it came out much closer to the consistency that I prefer for chili. Poured over cornbread and this meal is irresistible.
Tasty and wholesome!
Really good! I reduced the cayenne pepper because I don’t like it too spicy but that’s personal preference. Will definitely make again.

Great base. I used a 1 1/2 lbs of ground turkey, added green & red peppers with onion, smoked paprika and black beans in addition to kidney beans. I used to add corn but don't now due to dietary issues. It's loved by my guys!
Thumbs up from my family
I used ground beef instead of turkey. After simmering for 20 minutes, I removed the lid. It was soupy and went very well with cheddar cheese, sour cream and Italian bread. I will make it again.
I didn't have crushed tomatoes so I added Rao's marinara sauce, diced tomatoes and tomato paste. I added green pepper, red pepper and yellow pepper.
I made thus recipe today and it was very good. I added black beans and kidney beans. I used only 1 cup of water instead of 2. My husband liked it as well!
Excellent. Very tasty and just the right amount of heat.
So easy to follow and turned out great! When it was done, I added a spoonful of sour cream, shredded cheese, and Goldfish crackers to my bowl. Delish!
This chili was easy and delicious! Only change I made was adding Brooks Hot Chili Beans and a little Hot Chili Siracha. Served it over pasta. Will make again. Everyone loves it!

I really liked this recipe for its simplicity. I made some changes, mostly just additions. I added celery and mini sweet bell peppers to mine. I sautéed them all before adding the turkey to ensure they were truly softened. I added whole tomatoes which I then crushed myself (I prefer the method) and I added a can of tomato sauce along with the water for more flavor. I doubled the kidney beans to make it more hearty and I decreased the amount of chili powder. The amount of spice was perfect! This recipe is so great because it is so easily customizable. So very very easy!
It was so easy and absolutely delicious. I froze it and had it for my work lunches for a while. I will definitely make this again.

No Changes, I will make it again
loved it
Simple added a can of southwest corn - added a little sweet to the heat
Pretty.good the way it is, but did reduce the water, we like it thicker.

Great base! Use these additions if you like a lot of flavor, spice (kick), and thicker chili. Don't bother scrolling through other reviews, cuz I stole everything worth mentioning. ; ) If I don't mention it, use what's in the original recipe. I don't lose anything, except the water, but I add a lot. 1 tbsp olive oil. 1 cup low sodium chicken broth. 1 can (10.5 - 16 oz) diced tomatoes (any) I like Rotel original and hot. 2 cans beans (any bean) For my double batch I use 1 chili bean (not drained & rinsed ), 1 black bean (D & R), and 2 red kidney beans (1 mashed & 1 whole - both D & R). 2 1/2 tbsp chili powder. 1 tsp dried oregano. 1 tsp cayenne. 1 tsp cummin. 3/4 tsp black pepper. 1 can of corn (D & R). 1 4 oz can of green chillies. 2 jalapeños (diced). 1 green & 1 red pepper (chopped). 1/4 tsp cinnamon. 1 tbsp brown sugar. 1/2 tsp nutmeg. Montreal seasoning to taste when browning turkey. Start by sautéing onion in half the oil. Cook til softened, then add peppers & jalapeños. Cook til softened, and then remove. Add rest of oil and brown turkey. Once evenly browned, add back the onions & peppers. Add garlic and cook for 2 min. Add all seasoning and cook for another 2 min, while constantly stirring. Dump in all remaining ingredients. Bring to a boil, then reduce to low and cover. Cook for 75 min, and stir once halfway through. Once done, stir again, and let sit. Gets better with age. Serve with sour cream and sharp cheddar. Hope this helps someone. Sorry for the layout...
I pretty much followed the recipe but added some celery and lessened chili powder. Versatile and enjoyable. Will likely make again.
Rey good and I will make it again.

This is a great basic turkey chili recipe. I didn't have chili powder, so used 2 Tbsp of taco seasoning, which was just fine. I also used smoked paprika instead of regular, and think it's an improvement. I used a chopped turkey breast instead of ground turkey and fried the onions in the fat from roasted breast, which seems nice. I also added frozen corn, as I love that in chilis, as well as some chopped red pepper I had in the freezer. Tastes very good right now, but probably even better tomorrow! I'll serve w/ grated cheese, sour cream and some corn bread. Yum!!!
My family loves it!

The recipe definitely calls for too much water, I would use 1 cup instead of 2 next time. I had to let it reduce for 30 min and add flour to thicken it to my liking. Also had to add a lot more seasoning than what it called for. But overall it's a decent base for a chili.
I added about two cups of chopped extra vegetables ( red and green sweet peppers, yellow zucchini) and sauteed the onions and peppers before adding the turkey .
I used ground chicken. Added some cinnamon and dark chocolate. Perfect.
Overall, the chili was good! I just felt like it tasted "thin", and needed more salt and spice. But the base was really good!
Quick, easy, and tasty. Will definitely make it again, but will cut back on the water and hot spices up front (for my husband, go all in for myself!)

I give it 5 stars for being a tasty quick basic chili with ingredients that I always have on hand. I made it exactly by the recipe this time and will alter it in the future depending if I am feeding picky grandchildren or a more sophisticated palate.

can use a slow cooker - 8 hours on low
I added 4oz green chilies
I mashed 1/2 of the kidney beans
reduced water to 1 cups
added 1/2 green pepper diced

This recipe is missing flavor. I think it needs more meat and another bean. My family said it was "ok". I usually have success with Allrecipes, but this one was not a winner. We put it on hot dogs the next day. Much better as a hot dog chili.

This recipe was good but lacked a bit of flavor for me. My first instinct was to add some vinegar and sugar. I actually ended up adding some organic ketchup and it gave it that sweet/acidic flavor I felt like it was lacking.
My husband says it’s the best he’s had!

Very good. Used 1 can of mild chili beans and maybe equivalent of 1 can of kidney beans. Cut the water in 1/2 and used chix broth. Put in 1 T. chili powder. I cooked turkey and onions together, added 1 clove ch. garlic, and then added 1 stalk of ch. celery. Also added spices and sauteed them a minute or two before adding other ingredients.

I love this and mix it up with ground beef sometimes. I use less water tho so it’s not so “soupy”. I use about 1-1.25 cups of water. My husband loves it and so do it! I add a little sour cream and cheddar on top and serve it with a slice of cornbread! Mmmmm!
I followed this recipe and added three packs of equal in the pot. I like my chili just a dash sweet with a pinch of cinnamon.
